  2. Plants use the "wood wide web" to eavesdrop on neighbours  Yourweather.co.uk
  3. Study shows plants are more likely to be ‘eavesdroppers’ than altruists when tapping into underground networks  University of Oxford
  4. Plants Use Fungal Networks to Eavesdrop on Neighbors  ShiaWaves | Shia World News
  5. Plants more likely to 'eavesdrop' on neighbours than warn them of danger  Yahoo News UK

item.title: Where did dinosaurs come from? Scientists say they figured it out - Earth.com
item.description:
1. Where did dinosaurs come from? Scientists say they figured it out  Earth.com
  2. Scientists Think the World's Oldest Dinosaur Fossils May Still Be Awaiting Discovery  Popular Mechanics
  3. Where did dinosaurs first evolve? Scientists have an answer  Reuters
  4. Early Dinosaur Fossils May Lie Hidden Beneath Amazon And Sahara  Evrim Ağacı
  5. Scientists may have solved the mystery of dinosaurs' origins  The Economic Times
